it.polito.dp2.NFV

Interface NfvReader


  • public interface NfvReader
    An interface for reading information about the DP2-NFV system (fixed, revision1).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConnectionPerformanceReader getConnectionPerformance(HostReader host1, HostReader host2)
      Gives the ConnectionPerformanceReader object for the link from one host to another one
      HostReader getHost(java.lang.String name)
      Gives access to a single host, available in the IN, given its name.
      java.util.Set<HostReader> getHosts()
      Gives access to the set of known hosts, available in the IN.
      NffgReader getNffg(java.lang.String name)
      Gives access to a single NF-FG given its name.
      java.util.Set<NffgReader> getNffgs(java.util.Calendar since)
      Gives access to the set of known NF-FGs deployed since a given date.
      java.util.Set<VNFTypeReader> getVNFCatalog()
      Gives access to the catalog of supported network function types

    • Method Detail

      • getNffgs

        java.util.Set<NffgReader> getNffgs(java.util.Calendar since)
        Gives access to the set of known NF-FGs deployed since a given date.
        Parameters:
        since - the deploy date and time since when we are considering NF-FGs. A null value means that all NF-FGs are considered.
        Returns:
        a set of interfaces for reading the selected NF-FGs.

      • getNffg

        NffgReader getNffg(java.lang.String name)
        Gives access to a single NF-FG given its name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the NF-FG to get (a string made of alphanumeric characters only, where the first character is alphabetic).
        Returns:
        an interface for reading information about the NF-FG with the given name or null if an NF-FG with the given name is not available.

      • getHosts

        java.util.Set<HostReader> getHosts()
        Gives access to the set of known hosts, available in the IN.
        Returns:
        a set of interfaces for reading all available hosts.

      • getHost

        HostReader getHost(java.lang.String name)
        Gives access to a single host, available in the IN, given its name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the host to get (a string made of alphanumeric characters only, where the first character is alphabetic).
        Returns:
        an interface for reading information about the host with the given name or null if a host with the given name is not available.

      • getVNFCatalog

        java.util.Set<VNFTypeReader> getVNFCatalog()
        Gives access to the catalog of supported network function types
        Returns:
        a set of interfaces for reading all the network function types available in the system.

      • getConnectionPerformance

        ConnectionPerformanceReader getConnectionPerformance(HostReader host1,
                                                     HostReader host2)
        Gives the ConnectionPerformanceReader object for the link from one host to another one
        Parameters:
        host1 - the start host of the link for which the object has to be returned
        host2 - the end host of the link for which the object has to be returned
        Returns:
        the ConnectionPerformanceReader object for the link from host1 to host2, or null if no link exists between host1 and host2
